characters.name: Amos
characters.summary: Shepherd and fig tree farmer from Tekoa in Judah who was called by God to prophesy against the Northern Kingdom of Israel during the reign of Jeroboam II, exposing religious hypocrisy, condemning social injustice, and announcing the Day of the Lord.

characters.name: Jeroboam II
characters.meaning: The people contend / May the people multiply
characters.summary: King of Israel during Amos's ministry who presided over a period of unprecedented prosperity and territorial expansion, yet whose reign was marked by idolatry and social injustice that provoked divine judgment.

characters.name: Uzziah (Azariah)
characters.meaning: Yahweh is my strength / Yahweh has helped
characters.summary: King of Judah during Amos's ministry, contemporary of Jeroboam II, whose long reign was generally prosperous until pride led to his downfall when he unlawfully burned incense in the temple.

characters.name: Amaziah (Priest of Bethel)
characters.summary: Priest of Bethel who confronted Amos, accused him of conspiracy against Jeroboam II, and ordered him to return to Judah—receiving a devastating personal prophecy of judgment in response.
